unit_learning_outcomes.description: Evaluate the roles of fixed income securities in portfolio construction and their market operations.
Analyse the different types of fixed income securities and their characteristics.
Apply strategies and interest rate immunization in fixed income securities management.
Examine the methods of valuing different types of fixed income securities.

enrolment_rules.description: AFIN6012 or ACST603 or ACST6003 or Admission to MFin

assessments.description: A closed book 90 minute test will be held during the session.
Students will work in groups to conduct quantitative and qualitative research, and will produce a written report of their findings.
A two hour online open book final examination will be held during the University Examination Period.
Two online submissions of homework assessments. Due dates will be provided in iLearn.

The project will cover quantitative and qualitative research on a case study. Students will be required to work in groups and produce a report of between 2,000 to 2,500 words. 50% of the marks will be allocated to individual performance.
A two hour closed book final examination will be held during the University Examination Period.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Special circumstances
data.subject_search_title: AFIN8012 - Fixed Income and Credit Analysis
data.description: This unit introduces students to the financial world of fixed income securities and their markets, explains the risks of these securities, and presents the tools used in their valuation. The unit focuses on both the theoretical and practical aspects of fixed income investment. The topics covered include analysis of fixed income securities and markets, term structure of interest rates, valuation principles of various types of fixed income securities, and portfolio management strategies using fixed income securities.
